Motivation

Definition of an estimator:

\[\hat{\mathbf{\theta}} : \mathcal{S}^m \to \Theta\]

Permutation invariance:

\[\hat{\mathbf{\theta}}(\mathbf{Z}_1, \dots, \mathbf{Z}_m) = \hat{\mathbf{\theta}}(\mathbf{Z}_{\pi(1)}, \dots, \mathbf{Z}_{\pi(m)})\]

Under some arbitrary loss function $L(\mathbf{\theta}, \hat{\mathbf{\theta}}(\mathcal{Z}))$, the risk function:

\[R(\mathbf{\theta}, \hat{\mathbf{\theta}}(\cdot)) \equiv \int_{\mathcal{S}^m} L(\mathbf{\theta}, \hat{\mathbf{\theta}}(\mathcal{Z}))p(\mathcal{Z} \mid \mathbf{\theta}) d \mathcal{Z}\]

Weighted average risk function:

\[r_{\Omega}(\hat{\mathbf{\theta}}(\cdot)) \equiv \int_\Theta R(\mathbf{\theta}, \hat{\mathbf{\theta}}(\cdot)) d\Omega(\mathbf{\theta}), \]

Deep Set (Zaheer et al., 2017) representation of an estimator:

\[\begin{aligned} \hat{\mathbf{\theta}}(\mathcal{Z}) &= \mathbf{\phi}(\mathbf{T}(\mathcal{Z})) \\ \mathbf{T}(\mathcal{Z}) &= \sum_{\mathbf{Z} \in \mathcal{Z}} \mathbf{\psi}(\mathbf{Z}) \end{aligned}\]

Optimisation task:

\[\hat{\mathbf{\theta}}_{\mathbf{\gamma}^*}(\cdot): \mathbf{\gamma}^* \equiv \underset{\mathbf{\gamma}}{\mathrm{arg\,min}} \; r_{\Omega}(\hat{\mathbf{\theta}}_{\mathbf{\gamma}}(\cdot)).\]

Monte Carlo approximation of the weighted average risk:

\[r_{\Omega}(\hat{\mathbf{\theta}}(\cdot)) \approx \frac{1}{K} \sum_{k = 1}^K \frac{1}{J} \sum_{j = 1}^J L(\mathbf{\theta}_k, \hat{\mathbf{\theta}}(\mathcal{Z}_{kj})). \]
